Reviews.Content: Not so great       bathroom
Reviews.Author: HayleyM_87

Reviews.Content: Great place to stay We couldn't have asked for a nicer place to stay. While we were staying at the dependance, the main hotel building is right next to the duomo. Our room was a cheerful pink and although the loo was a bit small, it was very clean. The breakfast was lovely and is served in your room, if you want. The staff is charming and lovely. I would stay there everytime.
Reviews.Author: pinkyNewDelhi

Reviews.Content: Excellent Location       View of the hotel from the bell tower
Reviews.Author: ClumsyIsis

Reviews.Content: Great Location! Hotel San Giovanni was a great location at a great price. As other hotels said, this is a no-frills place. Breakfast is not included, but that is not a big deal because there are plenty of shops around. And of course, since you are in Florence, you aren't staying in your room much anyway!The view from our room was fabulous - you could see the Duomo! The ceiling was high which made the room feel large and airy. Our bathroom was across the hall but we had a sink in our room. Three of us (twenty-something girls) stayed in one room and there was plenty of room for our stuff and even a small table. The sheets were clean - our only complaint would be the quality of the towels provided. I'd bring my own in the future.Everything in Florence is in walking distance from the hotel, including lots of restaurants. There is no internet access here, but there are many internet cafes close to the hotel as well.
Reviews.Author: lallamarquez

Reviews.Content: Great location, average hotel       Procession going by below our hotel room window
Reviews.Author: SuzanneD_001

Reviews.Content: I got bedbug bites here!!! The location was great, if not hard to find, the room was okay, the bathroom was fine, the man at the desk was nice, but the next day I was itchy all over, and noticed red welts all over me - bedbugs!! Not fun.
Reviews.Author: suzy301

Reviews.Content: would not stay here again well the best thing about this hotel was the location. it was really convienent location next to the duomo.the rooms were a fair size and it was airconditioned but the bathroom was scary.the shower was really tiny with this flimsy shower cutain that would stick to you while you showered.i can't tell you how much that grossed me out and i refused to shower after .the best way to sit on the toliet was to sit sideways or your knees would hit the wall and the alternative shower(a shower head on the wall in case you wanted to shower over the toliet instead) when we left the hotel room and i went to double check to see if the door was locked,the lock kinda gave way, like if i pushed hard enough the door would open. didn't make me feel safe.it did have a hostel kinda feeling.but for the price for budget travellers, it might be o.k. i don't think i would stay here again
Reviews.Author: snoopstergurl

Reviews.Content: Great location, friendly place I am a seasoned traveller and have stayed in loads of hotels, especially in Italy. This is not a posh hotel (and the price reflects this), but, it is charming and has loads of character.We had a triple room with ample breakfast in middle of August for 75 euros, with view of the duomo from the window. There was a fresco on the ceiling.The furniture is slightly worn and the walls are thin but we can a really nice time here. The staff were very friendly too.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: So-So You can readily hear conversation through the walls (which i guess is about the same for all places at this price range in Italy). This makes for a potentially loud nights sleep (if other guest are loud). The mural on ceiling was unique. Staff was friendly but did not speak much english. Good location, even better if the duomo wasnt under construction/renovation. Furniture was below average. I liked their website better then the place.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Great price, location and people We have stayed at this hotel for a total of 5 weeks over 3 different years 2001, 2003 and 2005, and it is still the best price for the extremely close location to all the sights. The people who run the hotel speak English and are very helpful and friendly. I had a problem with another hotel keeping my drivers license and if not for San Giovanni, I would never have gotten it back.It is NOT Ramada Inn or Best Western or room service w/ a view -- This is a trip to Europe, not the 50 states of the U.S. There is a bit of funk to the rooms, but some of them have ceiling frescoes and the place is very clean. I have taken 11 long term trips to Europe over the past 11 years and I would rate this among the top 5 hotels I have stayed at for the price. We plan to stay there again!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: It's more like a hostel than a hotel It's more like a hostel than a hotel. They charge a lot for a room with private shower. But it's really not worth it, because the shower is very old and small. The only good thing about San Giovanni is its location, next to the Duomo. If you can, try to avoid staying at this hotel.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Rusted Pipes, Broken Furniture in the Heart of Florence Please do not be fooled by the pictures!! This hotel is pathetic and depressing in every way, except for its location. Our room had broken and damaged furniture, a clogged sink and broken lights. The bathrooms down the hall were ill equipped and often dirty with rusty exposed pipes. Breakfast across the street was nothing more than a roll and Nescafe. It may be central, but it is a loser in every other way.
Reviews.Author: Emily64

Reviews.Content: Perfect for Budget Travellers Had room 5 between 14-18 Feb. A great stay for people on a budget. This no frills place is great. I'd stay here again. Clean, bright, friendly staff. Surprisingly quiet for not very thick walls between rooms and right on the across from the Baptistry. Hot showers, plenty of water, in-room sink. Room as promised. Comfortable yet firm beds.
Reviews.Author: cooperpd

Reviews.Content: Superb location This hotel could not be in a better location - it really is right over the road from the duomo and baptistery. It certainly has atmosphere and is very secure, although the water pressure in our bathroom was poor and we ended up using the corridor shower. However, it is relatively cheap, especially when you consider that the feast of Florence is right at your doorstep. The managers were very helpful - we'd certainly stay there again!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
